h1_38: St Luke’s Hospital – Anderson Campus Program
span_48: St Luke’s Hospital – Anderson Campus Program
p_64: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_68: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_79: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_97: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_100: St. Luke’s, a large integrated health network, provides subspecialty level DR training with diverse pathology and robust case volume. You will train at a GE show site with the latest AI products and state of the art SIMS lab. The health system includes a level I trauma center, comprehensive stroke center, pediatric specialty care facility and nationally recognized cancer center. Curriculum incorporates noninterpretative topics such as business of radiology, informatics, QI, and wellness.
